response_parsed.title: Harden Microservices Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive overview on how to secure and harden your microservices when building them using FastAPI in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Adopting security best practices from the outset ensures your microservices are robust and resilient against threats.
FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python, offers built-in features to help secure your applications.
Utilize FastAPI's OpenAPI integration for documentation and testing to ensure consistency and quality.
Implement authentication and authorization using industry-standard protocols such as JSON Web Tokens (JWT).
Enable HTTPS by configuring SSL/TLS certificates, ensuring data in transit is encrypted.
Use FastAPI's dependency injection system to validate incoming requests and protect against common attacks like SQL injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

version_notes: The examples provided are compatible with Python 3.12+ and FastAPI version 0.78.0.
Make sure to update the dependencies in your project's requirements file accordingly.
caveats: Always remember to choose strong secrets for your JWT secret key and SSL/TLS certificates.
Never share or expose sensitive information, such as API keys or database credentials, in your code or version control system.
Stay up-to-date with the latest security advisories and patches for both FastAPI and other dependencies.
